sections: will host a live chat about the fight for Medicare for All with Dr. Abdul El-Sayed and Dr. Micah Johnson, who have co-authored a new book on the subject. We will explore a big question: With Democrats controlling the presidency and Congress, what are the prospects for expanding guaranteed health care to all?

Dr. El-Sayed is a physician, epidemiologist, and progressive activist who rebuilt Detroit's Health Department after the City's bankruptcy as the youngest big-city health commissioner in a major U.S. city. He also ran for governor of Michigan in 2018. He is the Chair of Southpaw Michigan and a Political Contributor at CNN. His book,
Healing Politics: A Doctor’s Journey into the Heart of Our Political Epidemic
, diagnoses our country’s epidemic of insecurity and the empathy politics we will need to treat it, and his forthcoming book
Medicare for All: A Citizen’s Guide

Dr. Micah Johnson is a physician and a health care researcher, writer, and policy advisor. He served as a health policy fellow in the U.S. House of Representatives and has advised presidential campaigns on health care reform.
These events are exclusively for Daily Poster subscribers, who will be able to watch the broadcasts live and ask questions in real time.
Please register for the event ahead of time at the Crowdcast link below — and please start posting your questions in the chat room
The live chat with El-Sayed and Johnson will take place on Wednesday 1/27 at 7:39pm ET (4:30pm PST).
To participate, subscribers should go to this link: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/medicareforall
• Go to the event link and register for the event right now so that you don’t have to deal with login/registration issues at the time of the event.
• Copy and paste the event URL into your browser and copy and paste the event password in. The event URL is: https://www.crowdcast.io/e/medicareforall
• If possible, please try to use a regular desktop or laptop computer, and use the Chrome browser. You can read more about browser compatibility
• If you want to participate using an iPhone or iPad, you can download Crowdcast’s app

• If you are connected to the live broadcast and have connectivity issues, you should refresh your browser; hit "Help" at the top of the screen (which enters you into compatibility mode); and click the settings cog icon on the bottom right corner and switch to 360p resolution.
